Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Grand Style pottery heavy chalice; creamy white slip; interior glazed black with two added red bands and perhaps an added white band, above top of lotus buds in red and white and dotted white circle with red centre; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of figure to left wearing chiton and himation in red, white and black with brown dots; at top break break part of left hand holding a white staff of some kind.
Curator's comments: A number of Chian chalices from Emporio (Lemos no. 1468) and Rizari (Lemos no, 1487) depict komast dancers alongside female figures dressed in long chitons and playing the double flute and tambourine (or possibly holding a wreath). Occasionally, the female figure is holding a pomegranate. On some chalices, the female figures are incised whilst on others, they are depicted in outline. The figures on the sherds from Naukratis are likely to be from similar scenes interpreted as dancers following and performing with a chorus of women.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 274, no. 718, pl. II, pl. 94)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0784) (phase 2)
